definitions.definition: An addictive alkaloid narcotic derived from opium and used as a hypnotic, analgesic and cough suppressant; often mixed with aspirin etc.
Of or pertaining to philanthropy; characterized by philanthropy; loving or helping mankind
definitions.example: a philanthropic enterprise

definitions.definition: (racing) A race in which the animal being raced finishes in a state of physical exhaustion.
A gruelling ordeal.
So difficult or taxing as to make one exhausted; backbreaking.
An academy for the advanced study of Jewish texts.
An individual who is going through puberty.
At or just after the age of puberty.
Covered with down or fine hairs.
To relate (a story or series of events) in speech or writing.
To give an account.

Small oval bodies of the lymphatic system, distributed along the lymphatic vessels, that are clustered in the armpits, groin, neck, chest and abdomen. They act as filters, with an internal honeycomb of connective tissue filled with lymphocytes and macrophages that collect and destroy bacteria, viruses and foreign matter from lymph. When the body is fighting an infection, these lymphocytes multiply rapidly and produce a characteristic swelling of the lymph nodes.
A minor fight or argument.
definitions.example: The children got into a squabble about who should ride in the front of the car.

definitions.definition: To participate in a minor fight or argument.
definitions.example: The brothers were always squabbling with each other.

definitions.definition: To disarrange, so that the letters or lines stand awry and require readjustment.
definitions.example: to squabble type

definitions.definition: Which has no weight.
Which is not being affected by gravity.
A technique used to encourage people to sell their property by giving the impression that a neighborhood is changing for the worse, especially by implying a change in its racial makeup
Having the characteristics of a blockbuster; hugely successful.
definitions.example: a blockbusting movie

definitions.definition: A horse soldier; a cavalryman, who uses a horse for mobility, but fights dismounted.
A carrier of a dragon musket.
A variety of pigeon.
To force (someone) into doing something; to coerce.
To surrender (a person) to the fury of soldiers.
Animated, gay or vivacious; lively, spirited.
Of a person: full of life and vigour, especially with a light and springy step.
Of or relating to a sprite; ghostly, spectral.
In a lively and vigorous way; sprightlily.
Open land that has an acidic peaty soil and is mostly covered with heather or bracken.
An inflammation of the larynx, typically resulting in hoarseness.
A nonmetallic chemical element (symbol As) with an atomic number of 33.
A single atom of this element.
Arsenic trioxide.
Of or containing arsenic with a valence of 5.

The process of determining the maximum acceptable level of overall risk to and from a proposed activity, then using risk assessment techniques to determine the initial level of risk and, if this is excessive, developing a strategy to ameliorate appropriate individual risks until the overall level of risk is reduced to an acceptable level.
Any of the variations of high speed pitches thrown in baseball

A four-seam fastball, which is a backspin pitch thrown with a ball gripped in the direction to cause four of the seams of the ball to cross the flight path and released with roughly equal pressure by the index and middle fingers
definitions.example: The pitcher had a blazing fastball.

definitions.definition: A passageway through which to enter or leave, such as one between seating areas in an auditorium, or between two buildings.
An articulating bridge or ramp, such as from land to a dock or a ship.
A temporary passageway, such as one made of planks.
(obsolete outside dialectal) A clear path through a crowd or a passageway with people.
An aisle.
A passage along either side of a ship's upper deck.
A passage through the side of a ship or an opening in the railing through which the ship may be boarded.
(agricultural) An earthen and plank ramp leading from the stable yard into the upper storey or mow of a dairy barn.
(Chicago) The narrow space between two buildings or houses, used to access the backyard/alleyway from the front.
A passageway through a passenger car
To serve as, furnish with, or conduct oneself as though proceeding on a gangway.
(to a crowd) Make way! Clear a path!
A system for showing cinema-quality films at home; usually comprising high-definition television and surround sound
(by extension) A dedicated room for such a system.
Either of a pair of propositions, that cannot both be true or both be false.
That contradicts something, such as an argument.
That is itself a contradiction.
That is diametrically opposed to something.
Mutually exclusive.
Tending to contradict or oppose, contrarious.
The therapeutic use of ionizing radiation, almost exclusively used for the treatment of malignant disease.
An SI/MKS unit of measure, the length of 1/1000 of a metre. Symbol: mm
To yield to an overpowering force or overwhelming desire.
definitions.example: Thai culture as in many other Asian cultures, is succumbing to the influence of westernization.

definitions.definition: To give up, or give in.
To die.
definitions.example: succumb to pneumonia

definitions.definition: To overwhelm or bring down.
A person occupied with surveying -- the process of determining positions on the earth's surface.
A person charged with inspecting something for the purpose of determining its condition, value, etc.
definitions.example: Other costs associated with selling a home include surveyor's fees, legal fees, estate agent's commission, stamp duty and the VAT.

definitions.definition: A kind of sports shoe that extends significantly over the wearer's ankle.
Place where pedestrians can cross a street.
A mapping between equivalent elements (fields) in different database schemas.
To map equivalent elements (fields) in different database schemas.
A closely woven fabric (originally of silk, now also of cotton or man-made fibres) with a thick short pile on one side.
Very fine fur, including the skin and fur on a deer's antlers.
A female chinchilla; a sow.
The drug dextromethorphan.
Money acquired by gambling.
To cover with velvet or with a covering of a similar texture.
To coat raw meat in starch, then in oil, preparatory to frying.
To remove the velvet from a deer's antlers.
To soften; to mitigate.
(of a cat's claws) to retract.
Made of velvet.
Soft and delicate, like velvet; velvety.
Peaceful, carried out without violence; especially as pertaining to the peaceful breakup of Czechoslovakia.
The door used by actors and other professionals when entering or leaving a theatre
Any of several wading birds in the genus Scolopax, of the family Scolopacidae, characterised by a long slender bill and cryptic brown and blackish plumage.
A simpleton.
To dress in insufficiently warm clothes.
To dress in insufficiently formal clothes.
Insufficiently dressed, as for cold weather.
Insufficiently well-dressed, as for a formal event.
To stake or pledge upon the outcome of an event; to wager.
To be sure of something; to be able to count on something.
definitions.example:
Fancy going for a drink after work?
You bet I do!

definitions.definition: To place money into the pot in order to require others do the same, usually only used for the first person to place money in the pot on each round.
The act of placing a bet.
Describing one who bets or gambles.
definitions.example: If I were a betting man, I'd wager my next pay check he couldn't do that again.

definitions.definition: An instruction given to an actor that tells the actor what should be done and in what manner to do it.
definitions.example: The stage direction given in the script said to walk forward and speak the line loudly.

definitions.definition: An alcoholic liquor distilled from the fermented juice of the Central American century plant Agave tequilana
(heading, physical) To move or be moved into something.
(heading, social) To diminish or be diminished.
To conceal and appropriate.
To keep out of sight; to suppress; to ignore.
To pay absolutely.
definitions.example: I have sunk thousands of pounds into this project.

definitions.definition: To reduce or extinguish by payment.
definitions.example: to sink the national debt

definitions.definition: To be overwhelmed or depressed; to fail in strength.
To decrease in volume, as a river; to subside; to become diminished in volume or in apparent height.
Caused, by natural or unnatural means, to be depressed (lower than the surrounding area) or submerged
definitions.example: The sunken ship lay at a depth of 100 feet

definitions.definition: (of eyes or cheeks) Seeming to have fallen deeper back into the face due to tiredness, illness, or old age.
definitions.example: She looked old and thin with sunken cheeks and hollow eyes.

definitions.definition: Any of various small American birds in the family Trochilidae that have the ability to hover.
A body of electors empowered to elect someone to a particular office.
Alternative letter-case form of Electoral College.
Any of various types of snakes having a copper-colored head.
Someone with ginger hair.
The act of desolating or laying waste; destruction of inhabitants; depopulation.
The state of being desolated or laid waste
A place or country wasted and forsaken.
The use of a single characteristic or part of an object, concept or phenomenon to identify the entire object, concept, phenomenon or a related object.
A metonym.
The art or practice of costuming oneself as a (usually fictional) character.
A skit or instance of this art or practice.
To costume oneself as a character.
definitions.example: She cosplayed at the manga convention.

definitions.definition: To costume oneself as (a character).
definitions.example: She cosplayed Sailor Moon at the manga convention.

definitions.definition: Any of certain marine bivalve mollusks, especially those of the family Ostreidae (the true oysters), usually found adhering to rocks or other fixed objects in shallow water along the seacoasts, or in brackish water in the mouth of rivers.
The delicate morsel of dark meat contained in a small cavity of the bone on each side of the lower part of the back of a fowl.
A pale beige color tinted with grey or pink, like that of an oyster.
(by analogy) A person who keeps secrets.
A shoplifter.
To fish for oysters.
Of a pale beige colour tinted with grey or pink, like that of an oyster.
To be or remain suspended.
definitions.example: The lights hung from the ceiling.

definitions.definition: To float, as if suspended.
definitions.example: The smoke hung in the room.

definitions.definition: (of a ball in cricket, tennis, etc.) To rebound unexpectedly or unusually slowly, due to backward spin on the ball or imperfections of the ground.
To hold or bear in a suspended or inclined manner or position instead of erect.
definitions.example: He hung his head in shame.

definitions.definition: To cause (something) to be suspended, as from a hook, hanger, hinges or the like.
definitions.example: Hang those lights from the ceiling.

definitions.definition: To execute (someone) by suspension from the neck.
definitions.example: The culprits were hanged from the nearest tree.

definitions.definition: To be executed by suspension by one's neck from a gallows, a tree, or other raised bar, attached by a rope tied into a noose.
definitions.example: You will hang for this, my friend.

definitions.definition: (used in maledictions) To damn.
To loiter, hang around, to spend time idly.
definitions.example: Are you busy, or can you hang with me?  I didn't see anything, officer. I was just hanging.

definitions.definition: To exhibit (an object) by hanging.
To apply (wallpaper or drywall to a wall).
definitions.example: Let's hang this cute animal design in the nursery.

definitions.definition: To decorate (something) with hanging objects.
definitions.example: Let's hang the nursery with some new wallpaper.

definitions.definition: To remain persistently in one's thoughts.
To prevent from reaching a decision, especially by refusing to join in a verdict that must be unanimous.
definitions.example: One obstinate juror can hang a jury.

definitions.definition: To stop responding to manual input devices such as keyboard and mouse.
definitions.example: The computer has hung again. Not even pressing ++ works.  When I push this button the program hangs.

definitions.definition: To cause (a program or computer) to stop responding.
definitions.example: The program has a bug that can hang the system.

definitions.definition: To cause (a piece) to become vulnerable to capture.
definitions.example: If you move there, you'll hang your rook.

definitions.definition: To be vulnerable to capture.
definitions.example: In this standard opening position White has to be careful because the pawn on e4 hangs.

definitions.definition: Of a pitcher, to throw a hittable off-speed pitch.
Suspended.
definitions.example: The hanging vines made the house look older than it was.

definitions.definition: (of a piece) Unprotected and exposed to capture.
(of an off-speed pitch) Hittable; poorly executed by the pitcher hence relatively easy to hit.
definitions.example: hanging breaking ball

definitions.definition: (of a person) ugly; very unattractive
The act of hanging a person (or oneself) by the neck in order to kill that person (or to commit suicide).
definitions.example: Hanging is the punishment for one convicted of war crimes, there.

definitions.definition: A sometimes public event at which a person is hanged.
definitions.example: The hanging of the bandits was attended by the whole village.

definitions.definition: Anything that is hung as a decorative element (such as curtains, gobelins or posters).
definitions.example: The various hangings on that Christmas tree look nice.

definitions.definition: The way in which hangings (decorations) are arranged.
definitions.example: I dislike the cramped hanging in the gallery of 18th century painters.

synonyms: a quick drop and a sudden stop

definitions.definition: (ball sports) A pass or stroke which arches high into the air.
definitions.example: The guard launched a desperate lob over the outstretched arms of the defender.

definitions.definition: To throw or hit a ball into the air in a high arch.
definitions.example: The guard lobbed a pass just over the defender.

definitions.definition: To throw.
To put, place
definitions.example: Lob it in the pot.

definitions.definition: To hit, kick, or throw a ball over another player in a game.
To let fall heavily or lazily.
A lump.
A country bumpkin; a yokel.
A clumsy person.
The person who comes last in a race.
A lobworm.
A fish, the European pollock.
To cob (chip off unwanted pieces of stone).
The Ebola virus.
Ebola fever.
Having no spine.
Cowardly; uncourageous.
The state of being entrapped.
definitions.example: The entrapment of the victims in the wreckage made rescue difficult.

definitions.definition: Action by law enforcement personnel to lead an otherwise innocent person to commit a crime, in order to arrest and prosecute that person for the crime.
definitions.example: A detective asking you to buy illegal marijuana for a dying man would be police entrapment.

definitions.definition: A method of isolating specific cells or molecules from a mixture, especially by immobilization on a gel.
A waiter or waitress.
A person who greets people on their arrival.
(tourism) A volunteer who shows tourists around their home city or region for free.
One who weeps or mourns.
To afflict with paralysis.
To make unable to move; to immobilize.
To make unable to function properly.
definitions.example: The transport strike paralysed the city.

definitions.definition: A man whose job it is to sell things, either in a shop/store or elsewhere.
Enthusiastic; high-spirited.
(of a liquid) Boiling or agitated as if boiling.
A theory that views environment, rather than heredity or culture, as the important factor in the development of an individual or group.
A political and social ideology that seeks to prevent the environment from degradation by human activity.
Of or pertaining to Byzantium.

(history) Belonging to the civilization of the Eastern Roman empire between 331, when its capital was moved to Constantinople, and 1453, when that capital was conquered by the Turks and ultimately renamed Istanbul.

Of a style of architecture prevalent in the Eastern Empire down to 1453, marked by the round arch springing from columns or piers, the dome supported upon pendentives, capitals elaborately sculptured, mosaic or other encrustations, etc.
Overly complex or intricate.
definitions.example: a Byzantine system of regulations

definitions.definition: Of a devious, usually stealthy, manner or practice.
Of or relating to the Byzantine Rite or any of the many Eastern Orthodox churches and Greek Catholic churches that use this rite for their liturgical celebrations
A byzant (coin).
Someone who plays golf.
The killing of an animal by a road vehicle
The animal(s) so killed
(by extension) a helpless victim
A member of a ship's crew who is responsible for steering.
A leader.
In a smart manner.
definitions.example: He was dressed smartly.

definitions.definition: Quickly.
Intelligently.
A period of time where one is not required to work.
definitions.example: I've got some time off next week, so maybe we could meet up then?

definitions.definition: An airfield:
A flying machine composed of aeroplanes. An aeroplane, particularly one constructed by or according to the design of Samuel Pierpont Langley and Charles M. Manly.
The systematic collection and evaluation of data regarding customers' preferences for actual and potential products and services.
Any of several marine molluscs of the family Octopodidae, having no internal or external protective shell or bone (unlike the nautilus, squid and cuttlefish) and eight arms each covered with suckers.
The flesh of these marine molluscs eaten as food.
An organization that has many powerful branches controlled from the centre.
To put (or attempt to put) one's fingers, hands or arms in many things or places at roughly the same time.
To spread out in long arms or legs in many directions.
To plug a large number of devices into a single electric outlet.
(by extension) To grow in use vastly beyond what was originally intended.
To hunt and catch octopuses.
To behave like an octopus.
To be unsuccessful, abort, come to nothing/naught; to be cancelled; not to proceed.
definitions.example: Their plans to go hiking Saturday fell through because it rained.

definitions.definition: A denomination of Buddhism.
Profound meditation within that denomination of Buddhism.
An approach to an activity, skill, or subject that emphasizes simplicity and intuition rather than conventional thinking or fixation on goals.
definitions.example: the zen of cooking; the zen of passing the bar exam; the zen of C++

definitions.definition: Pertaining to this denomination of Buddhism.
Enlightened, unburdened and free of worries; chill, extremely relaxed and collected.
A telephone booth
Cooked, sliced meat served cold, as in a sandwich or a tray of finger food.
The state or condition of a human being once it has reached physical maturity, and is presumed to have reached a state of psychological maturity, to wit: once it has become an adult.
The time period of a human being's majority; the time during which a human being has reached physical maturity, and ending with its death.
Someone or something that catches.
The player that squats behind home plate and receives the pitches from the pitcher
The bottom partner in a homosexual relationship or sexual encounter between two men.
Gibberish, unintelligible speech.
To jabber, talk rapidly and unintelligibly or incoherently.
A boulder, a stone; a mass of stone.
A balky horse.
A perfume used in the rites of various religions.
Homage; adulation.
To anger or infuriate.
definitions.example: I think it would incense him to learn the truth.

definitions.definition: To incite, stimulate.
To offer incense to.
To perfume with, or as with, incense.
To set on fire; to inflame; to kindle; to burn.
To give a piece of merchandise as part of the payment or trade for something new.
A jewel.
A piece of jewelry; a trinket.
A small intricate piece of metalwork.
Small, little (often implying affection)
(of a residence) small and elegant
Intricate; finely made
Either of two small, crepuscular rodents of the genus Chinchilla, native to the Andes, prized for their very soft fur and often kept as pets.
The fur of a chinchilla, used for clothing.
A variety of Persian cat with white fur and green eyes.
Negative effects, such as headache or nausea, caused by previous drunkenness due to (excessive) consumption of alcohol.
definitions.example: I really enjoyed yesterday’s party, but now I have the biggest hangover – I’ll not be doing that again any time soon.

definitions.definition: Similar negative effects caused by previous excessive consumption of something else, such as a drug, coffee, sugar, etc.
An unpleasant relic left from prior events.
A sleeping arrangement, usually in homeless shelters, over a rope.
A pattern of variation in a road's surface designed to alert inattentive drivers to potential danger by causing a tactile vibration and audible rumbling if they veer out of their lane.
A long, narrow container, open on top, for feeding or watering animals.
definitions.example: One of Hank's chores was to slop the pigs' trough each morning and evening.

definitions.definition: Any similarly shaped container.
A short, narrow canal designed to hold water until it drains or evaporates.
definitions.example: There was a small trough that the sump pump emptied into; it was filled with mosquito larvae.

definitions.definition: A gutter under the eaves of a building; an eaves trough.
definitions.example: The troughs were filled with leaves and needed clearing.

definitions.definition: A channel for conveying water or other farm liquids (such as milk) from place to place by gravity; any ‘U’ or ‘V’ cross-sectioned irrigation channel.
A long, narrow depression between waves or ridges; the low portion of a wave cycle.
definitions.example: The buoy bobbed between the crests and troughs of the waves moving across the bay.

definitions.definition: A linear atmospheric depression associated with a weather front.
To eat in a vulgar style, as if from a trough.
definitions.example: he troughed his way through three meat pies.

definitions.definition: A helmet, usually made from rigid plastic, used on construction sites to protect the head from falling objects.
A steamed suet pudding containing dried fruit, usually currants; traditional in England.
Champagne.
definitions.example: We're getting married–this calls for a bottle of bubbly!

definitions.definition: Full of bubbles.
definitions.example: Whip the egg white into a bubbly froth.

definitions.definition: Cheerful, lively.
definitions.example: She has a bubbly personality.

definitions.definition: Having the characteristics of bubbles.
definitions.example: The architecture of the conservatory was bubbly.

definitions.definition: Having the characteristics of economic bubbles.
An audio programme produced on a regular basis, delivered over the Internet in a compressed digital format and designed for playback on computers or portable digital audio players, such as the iPod.
To deliver (an audio programme) over the internet on a regular basis.
Either of two species of bird of the genus Pyrrhocorax in the crow family Corvidae that breed mainly in high mountains and on coastal sea cliffs of Eurasia.
The white-winged chough, of genus Corcorax in the Australian mud-nest builders family, Corcoracidae, that inhabits dry woodlands.
An act of inducting.
An act of inducing.
The process of inducing the birth process.
An introduction.
